alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 5:38PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Worcester and northeastern Franklin Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 538 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Northfield, or 8 miles northwest of Orange, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Greenfield, Orange, Gardner, Holden, Athol, Winchendon, Lunenburg, Montague, Lancaster, Templeton, Rutland, Sterling, West Boylston, Westminster, Ashburnham, Barre, Paxton and Hubbardston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western, central and northeastern Massachusetts.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Franklin; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin
